# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function `clean_column` takes a string `col`, converts it to lower case, strips any leading or trailing whitespaces and replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores. The `r"[\s-]" => "_"` part of the code is using regular expressions to replace all occurrences of whitespace characters (spaces and hyphens) with underscore.

You can use this function as follows:
```julia
col = "My Column"
cleaned_col = clean_column(col)
println(cleaned_col)  # Outputs: my_column
```
